issue.title: Add macOS ARM build (universal or additional binaries)
issue.body:
First ARM based Macs are available now.
See the porting guide https://developer.apple.com/documentation/xcode/porting_your_macos_apps_to_apple_silicon and the architectural differences: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/apple_silicon/addressing_architectural_differences_in_your_macos_code

Things to do:
* [x] fix depends build on ARM with macOS 10.16 (done in merged #20482)
* [x] fix CRC32 build issue (fix in #20603)
* [x] update macOS build readme (if required)
* [x] allow cross compiling ARM64 Mac on linux/gitian
* [x] fix `make deploy` on ARM64

events.body: apple ARM is running aarch64 binary?
Support for AArch64 NI SHA2 instructions should/could also be added.

Building on a ARM Mac with M1 via the depends build systems works with a few tweaks (https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20482 plus crc32 getauxval fix).

The harder part is now to get cross compilation to work.
It probably requires a newer clang then the just merged upgrade to 8 (we need `arm-apple-darwin`).
The Xcode 12.12 SDK is probably required ([here](https://bitcoin.jonasschnelli.ch/gitian/Xcode-12.2-12B45b-extracted-SDK-with-libcxx-headers.tar.gz)).
Qt 5.9 works for cross compilation but has visual glitches on macOS11.
Update to Qt LTS 5.15 might be a good idea (#19716).

I got error at with `make` command in root of `bitcoin` directory after manually applying patch to `qt.mk`. These are the steps I followed:

Installed Homebrew with this script:
https://gist.github.com/nrubin29/bea5aa83e8dfa91370fe83b62dad6dfa

command:
```
/bin/bash -c "$(curl -fsSL https://gist.githubusercontent.com/nrubin29/bea5aa83e8dfa91370fe83b62dad6dfa/raw/48f48f7fef21abb308e129a80b3214c2538fc611/homebrew_m1.sh)"
source ~/.zshrc
```

#### bitcoin install steps
```
git clone https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin
cd bitcoin/

# manually edited depends/packages/qt.mk file as per this git PR:
# https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20482/files

cd depends/
make
cd ..
./configure --prefix=$(pwd)/depends/arm-apple-darwin20.1.0  --with-gui=yes --disable-tests --disable-bench --enable-upnp-default --enable-experimental-asm --enable-static --disable-shared
make
```

got this error:
```
  CXX      leveldb/helpers/memenv/libmemenv_a-memenv.o
  AR       leveldb/libmemenv.a
gcc -I. -I./src -Wall -Wextra -Wno-unused-function -g -O2 -c src/gen_context.c -o gen_context.o
gcc -Wall -Wextra -Wno-unused-function -g -O2  gen_context.o -o gen_context
./gen_context
  CC       src/libsecp256k1_la-secp256k1.lo
  CCLD     libsecp256k1.la
  CXXLD    bitcoind
Undefined symbols for architecture arm64:
  "_getauxval", referenced from:
      crc32c::Extend(unsigned int, unsigned char const*, unsigned long) in libcrc32c.a(libcrc32c_a-crc32c.o)
ld: symbol(s) not found for architecture arm64
clang: error: linker command failed with exit code 1 (use -v to see invocation)
make[2]: *** [bitcoind] Error 1
make[1]: *** [all-recursive] Error 1
make: *** [all-recursive] Error 1
```

Is that expected? or did I miss anything?

@satindergrewal 
Yes. Somehow the crc32 library thinks we are on ARM linux and tries to use getauxval.

A quick fix is to change `getauxval(AT_HWCAP);` to `getauxval1(AT_HWCAP);` in `configure.ac` (I know a very lame fix!).
I'll do a proper PR soon.
Related #20603

I think we might have to bump to Qt 6.1 for this: https://bugreports.qt.io/browse/QTBUG-85279
There exists a qt5commpat layer which might be helpful for the transition: https://www.qt.io/blog/porting-from-qt-5-to-qt-6-using-qt5compat-library

Qt 6 also replaced qmake with cmake, which is much nicer to work with.

issue.title: RFC: Migrate from Qt5 to Qt6's Qt5 compat
issue.body:
It seems like migrating to Qt6 is a win for multiple efforts, and I want us to evaluate switching to it as an alternative to monkey-patching Qt5/qmake to make it work properly.

1. First class support for Apple Silicon for #20371 (see: https://bugreports.qt.io/browse/QTBUG-85279)
2. Transition from `qmake` to `cmake` (see: https://www.qt.io/blog/qt-6-build-system)
	1. We already use `cmake` in depends to build several other tools
	2. `cmake` is much better maintained than `qmake`
	3. This might make a native/build split possible for `qt`, the last holdout package of native/build mixing after `boost` was recently split
	4. For PRs like #20600, where we're trying to work around `qmake`'s jankiness, I don't want people to pour their heart and soul into making `qmake` work just to be completely replaced by `cmake` when we bump in the future

Supposedly, the switching cost is also minimal, as there's a Qt5Compat module (see: https://www.qt.io/blog/porting-from-qt-5-to-qt-6-using-qt5compat-library)

events.body: I have referenced the above solution and successfully compiled bitcoin. But I have a problem with the last command `make deploy`. https://gist.github.com/awesome-doge/9bfbd1d3fd9b725c4df224433fa3596e#file-build-apple-m1-version-of-bitcoin-md ``` âžœ bitcoin git:(master) make deploy build-aux/install-sh -c -d Bitcoin-Qt.app/Contents build-aux/install-sh -c -d Bitcoin-Qt.app/Contents/Resources build-aux/install-sh -c -d Bitcoin-Qt.app/Contents/Resources /usr/bin/install -c -m 644 src/qt/res/icons/bitcoin.icns Bitcoin-Qt.app/Contents/Resources/bitcoin.icns build-aux/install-sh -c -d Bitcoin-Qt.app/Contents /usr/bin/install -c -m 644 share/qt/Info.plist Bitcoin-Qt.app/Contents/Info.plist Making all in src Making all in doc/man make[1]: Nothing to be done for `all'. make[1]: Nothing to be done for `all-am'. build-aux/install-sh -c -d Bitcoin-Qt.app/Contents/MacOS STRIPPROG="/usr/bin/strip" /bin/sh /Users/doge/bitcoin/build-aux/install-sh -c -s ./src/qt/bitcoin-qt Bitcoin-Qt.app/Contents/MacOS/Bitcoin-Qt build-aux/install-sh -c -d Bitcoin-Qt.app/Contents/Resources/Base.lproj echo '{ CFBundleDisplayName = "Bitcoin Core"; CFBundleName = "Bitcoin Core"; }' > Bitcoin-Qt.app/Contents/Resources/Base.lproj/InfoPlist.strings /opt/homebrew/bin/python3.9 ./contrib/macdeploy/macdeployqtplus Bitcoin-Qt.app Bitcoin-Core -translations-dir=/Users/doge/bitcoin/depends/arm-apple-darwin20.2.0/translations -dmg Traceback (most recent call last): File "/Users/doge/bitcoin/./contrib/macdeploy/macdeployqtplus", line 22, in from ds_store import DSStore File "/Users/doge/bitcoin/depends/arm-apple-darwin20.2.0/native/lib/python3/dist-packages/ds_store/__init__.py", line 1, in from .store import DSStore, DSStoreEntry File "/Users/doge/bitcoin/depends/arm-apple-darwin20.2.0/native/lib/python3/dist-packages/ds_store/store.py", line 8, in import mac_alias File "/Users/doge/bitcoin/depends/arm-apple-darwin20.2.0/native/lib/python3/dist-packages/mac_alias/__init__.py", line 1, in from .alias import * File "/Users/doge/bitcoin/depends/arm-apple-darwin20.2.0/native/lib/python3/dist-packages/mac_alias/alias.py", line 16, in from . import osx File "/Users/doge/bitcoin/depends/arm-apple-darwin20.2.0/native/lib/python3/dist-packages/mac_alias/osx.py", line 424, in _statfs = libc['statfs$INODE64'] File "/opt/homebrew/Cellar/python@3.9/3.9.1_4/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.9/lib/python3.9/ctypes/__init__.py", line 392, in __getitem__ func = self._FuncPtr((name_or_ordinal, self)) AttributeError: dlsym(0x102b9d810, statfs$INODE64): symbol not found make: *** [Bitcoin-Core.dmg] Error 1 ``` The compiled bitcoin can be executed. But there will be some color problems on the setting page.

It seems that someone opened a related issue

build: `make deploy` fails on macOS Big Sur 11.1 #20878

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/20878

issue.title: doc: Add explicit macdeployqtplus dependencies install step
issue.body:
This PR adds to macOS docs an explicit step to install `macdeployqtplus` script dependencies that are not part of the [Python Standard Library](https://docs.python.org/3/library/index.html):
- https://pypi.org/project/ds-store/
- https://pypi.org/project/mac-alias/

This change is required on macOS 11 Big Sur:

-  #20371
- #20878

Close #20878.

issue.title: xaric 0.13.9
issue.body: Issues with `clang -Wimplicit-function-declaration` is now fixed so `$CFLAGS` workaround is no longer needed.

events.body: [Changing](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21555) mac_alias to [2.2.0](https://github.com/al45tair/mac_alias/issues/10) fixes `make deploy`
@jonasschnelli `make deploy` fix has been [committed](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/2cbb4ab7a92a281d7d7b4821654515dd59383ff3) to `master`

> @jonasschnelli `make deploy` fix has been [committed](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/2cbb4ab7a92a281d7d7b4821654515dd59383ff3) to `master`

So, is this update meaning master should build on ARM now? (newbie here just trying to run bitcoin on my new Mac)
@michaelsblank yes, that's what "committed to master" [means](https://www.atlassian.com/git/tutorials/saving-changes/git-commit)

> @michaelsblank yes, that's what "committed to master" [means](https://www.atlassian.com/git/tutorials/saving-changes/git-commit)

Yes, yes I know. I'm a developer. But, I should have been more precise. Does this now mean we can use the normal MacOS readme guide but for this latest commit and everything should build and run? I just found it odd that when I previewed the commit the change was just a version number and a hash change. If that got it running awesome, I just didn't know if there was more work to be done. Excuse me for my poor wording before. @sgulls

@michaelsblank 

I [mentioned](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/20371#issuecomment-810642505) the pertinent [issue](https://github.com/al45tair/mac_alias/issues/10) with one of the packages and in the issue, the maintainer said they fixed the issue that was encountered when building the app bundle and dmg. That fix was included in their [version bump](https://github.com/al45tair/mac_alias/issues/10#issuecomment-741145082).
@michaelsblank You seem to be one of few who have M1 hardware. Hands-on experience is welcome so feel free to write more here. Thanks!

Hi, I also have a Mac Mini M1 (up-to-date with Big Sur 11.3.1) and was able to previously compile 0.21.0. But now, when trying to update to 0.21.1, I ran into an error when compiling the dependencies by running 'make' in /depends subdirectory:

```
ERROR: Feature 'system-zlib' was enabled, but the pre-condition 'libs.zlib' failed. make: *** [/Users/xxx/bitcoin/depends/work/build/arm-apple-darwin20.2.0/qt/5.9.8-82a1b93ac0c/qtbase/.stamp_configured] Error 3
```

I thought maybe zlib was not installed, so I ran "brew install zlib", producing this output:

```
==> Pouring zlib--1.2.11.arm64_big_sur.bottle.tar.gz
==> Caveats
zlib is keg-only, which means it was not symlinked into /opt/homebrew,
because macOS already provides this software and installing another version in
parallel can cause all kinds of trouble.

For compilers to find zlib you may need to set:
  export LDFLAGS="-L/opt/homebrew/opt/zlib/lib"
  export CPPFLAGS="-I/opt/homebrew/opt/zlib/include"

For pkg-config to find zlib you may need to set:
  export PKG_CONFIG_PATH="/opt/homebrew/opt/zlib/lib/pkgconfig"
```


Even when adding these environment variables, I got the same error as shown above when trying to compile the dependencies, so I guess that attempt did not help. 

Any advice?

Since it's been 10 days, I hope it's ok to give this a small bump, @jonasschnelli.
As written above, I'd be happy to help testing on M1 architecture, but from the lack of feedback it seems there is currently not so much interest in it?

@ipa-tys building depends on an M1 machine should work fine at the moment. I know there are multiple people successfully building that way. If you are still having problems, then please open an issue with all the relevant info/logs. Make sure you've tried building depends from scratch etc.

If you're interested in cross-compilation for M1, you can check out #21851.
Thanks! Yes I tried building depends from scratch (which, as I mentioned above, had worked for me in 0.21.0). I will file a separate issue, as you suggested.

issue.title: Error when compiling on macOS Big Sur
issue.body:
### Can you reliably reproduce the issue?
#### If so, please list the steps to reproduce below:
1.  Clone pivx repository
2. install homebrew with arm64 architecture (/opt/homebrew)
3. brew install -s autoconf automake berkeley-db4 libtool boost miniupnpc pkg-config python3 qt5 zmq libevent qrencode gmp libsodium rust
I used -s just to be sure. I had problems with gmp when not doing it.

4. Update .zshrc so that it cointains
```
if [ "$(arch)" = "arm64" ]; then
  eval $(/opt/homebrew/bin/brew shellenv);
  export PATH="/opt/homebrew/opt/openssl@1.1/bin:$PATH"
  export LDFLAGS="-L/opt/homebrew/opt/openssl@1.1/lib -L/opt/homebrew/lib"
  export CPPFLAGS="-I/opt/homebrew/opt/openssl@1.1/include -I/opt/homebrew/include"
  export PKG_CONFIG_PATH="/opt/homebrew/opt/openssl@1.1/lib/pkgconfig"
else
  eval $(/usr/local/bin/brew shellenv);
  export PATH="/usr/local/opt/openssl@1.1/bin:$PATH"
  export LDFLAGS="-L/usr/local/opt/openssl@1.1/lib"
  export CPPFLAGS="-I/usr/local/opt/openssl@1.1/include"
fi
```
I had to add -L/opt/homebrew/lib and -I/opt/homebrew/include in addition to the build description for mac so that configure runs without an error. Otherwise ./configure would not find gmp.h
brew is installed for arm64 and x86_64. depending if running with rosetta the right version will be used...
5. Restart terminal
6. go to pivx folder
7. Run "git checkout 5.1"
8. Run "git pull"
9. Run "./autogen.sh"
10. Run "./configure --with-qrencode --with-zmq --with-gui"

### Expected behavior
Run ./configure without error

### Actual behavior
Got Error
```
checking whether to build PIVX Core GUI... yes (Qt5)
checking for boostlib >= 1.57.0... yes
checking whether the Boost::System library is available... yes
configure: error: Could not find a version of the boost_system library!
```

I suspect there is some mismatch with paths regarding arm64 libraries.
If for some tests I install the homebrew packages for x86_64 in an terminal running rosetta.
./configure will run fine in both terminals
however after installing the packages and try to build for arm64 there is a build error (most likely with the boost libraries) stating that there is no library for arm64 present.

events.body:
@jonasschnelli 
I've managed to cross compile from x86_64-linux-gnu to aarch64-apple-darwin20.4. I built [osxcross](https://github.com/tpoechtrager/osxcross) against the latest stable SDK (SDK version 11.3 from Xcode 12.5), added osxcross binaries to `$PATH` built the depends folder with 
`make HOST=aarch64-apple-darwin20.4 FORCE_USE_SYSTEM_CLANG=1 XCODE_VERSION=12.5 XCODE_BUILD_ID=12E262`
and successfully compiled a working GUI app bundle that ran on my arm64 Mac

issue.title: Apple Silicon M1 support
issue.body: When can we expect native support of flameshot for Apple Silicon Processors?

events.body:
> Support for AArch64 NI SHA2 instructions should/could also be added.

Added in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24115
Does Apple M1 have the "rng" extension (true RNG built into the CPU)?
Since https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21851 and others are merged already and 23.0 will have native arm64-darwin build I think we can close this issue?

> Does Apple M1 have the "rng" extension (true RNG built into the CPU)?

@sipa It seems it does - https://support.apple.com/en-gb/guide/security/sec59b0b31ff/web (search for "True Random Number Generator")

issue.title: [FEATURE] runtime detection on apple clang
issue.body:
```
/Users/denisarosevskij/space/eve/include/eve/arch/arm/detection.hpp:28:29: error: use of undeclared identifier 'AT_HWCAP'
    auto hwcaps = getauxval(AT_HWCAP);
                            ^
/Users/denisarosevskij/space/eve/include/eve/arch/arm/detection.hpp:38:29: error: use of undeclared identifier 'AT_HWCAP'
    auto hwcaps = getauxval(AT_HWCAP);
                            ^
/Users/denisarosevskij/space/eve/include/eve/arch/arm/detection.hpp:39:22: error: use of undeclared identifier 'HWCAP_ASIMD'
    return (hwcaps & HWCAP_ASIMD) != 0;
```

I found that bitcoin repo solved this:
Discussion: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/20371#issuecomment-740749188
PR: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20603/files
